# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

You can use the `replace` function from the String package to replace spaces and hyphens with an underscore. Then you can simply call `lowercase` on your resultant string which will convert it into lower case. 

Here is how you would implement this in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return lowercase(replace(col, " " => "_"))
end

println(clean_column("My Column")) # Outputs "my_column"
```
This function works as follows: 
- The function `clean_column` takes a string argument (`col`).
- It uses the built-in `replace` function from the String package to replace all spaces with underscores in the input string.
- Then it converts the whole thing into lower case using the `lowercase` function and returns this resultant string.
